questions.question: What is the main goal of the tandem utilization of CO2 photoreduction products for the carbonylation of aryl iodides?
questions.answer: The main goal is to effectively connect photocatalytic CO2 reduction and aminocarbonylation reactions in series to reconvert inexpensive photoreduction product CO into value-added and easily isolated fine chemicals.

questions.question: What are the key features of the MOF-based catalyst system NNU-55-Ni for photocatalytic CO2RR?
questions.answer: NNU-55-Ni exhibits high activity, selectivity, and durability for CO2 to CO photochemical conversion, and it can be exfoliated in situ to form ultrathin 2D nanosheets during the photocatalytic reaction process.

questions.question: How does the tandem reaction system work for converting CO2 to fine organic chemicals?
questions.answer: The tandem reaction system works by connecting a photocatalytic CO2 reduction reaction that produces CO with a subsequent aminocarbonylation reaction that converts CO into fine organic chemicals.

questions.question: What is the significance of synthesizing 13C isotope-labeled organic products through the tandem reaction?
questions.answer: Synthesizing 13C isotope-labeled organic products through the tandem reaction represents an effective method to use 13CO2 as a source of isotopically labeled amide molecules, suggesting promise in carbon isotope labeling chemistry.

questions.question: What are the advantages of connecting photocatalytic CO2 reduction with aminocarbonylation reaction in series?
questions.answer: The advantages include providing a safe, green, and effective CO generation pathway for aminocarbonylation, reconverting low-value CO into high-value organic chemicals, and achieving direct conversion from CO2 to value-added products.

questions.question: Is the tandem reaction system effective for different types of carbonylation reactions?
questions.answer: Yes, the tandem reaction system is effective for different types of carbonylation reactions, including aminocarbonylation, carbonylative Suzuki coupling, phenoxycarbonylation, and alkoxycarbonylation.

questions.question: What role does the MOF-based catalyst NNU-55-Ni play in the photocatalytic CO2 reduction reaction?
questions.answer: NNU-55-Ni serves as a catalyst for the photocatalytic CO2 reduction reaction, exhibiting high selectivity for CO2-to-CO conversion and transforming into nanosheets in situ to enhance photocatalytic performance.

questions.question: Can the tandem reaction system be used for the synthesis of isotopically labeled organic molecules?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Does the tandem reaction system only work for aminocarbonylation reactions?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Is the photocatalytic CO2 reduction reaction in the tandem system dependent on the use of large doses of toxic CO reactants?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Does the tandem reaction system provide a safe and green CO generation pathway for carbonylation reactions?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Is the photocatalytic CO2 reduction reaction in the tandem system only effective for producing CO?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Does the tandem reaction system limit the conversion of CO2 to only low-value products?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Can the tandem reaction system effectively suppress the competitive hydrogen evolution reaction?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Is the tandem reaction system limited to the synthesis of DEET as the final product?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the conversion rate of CO to DEET in the tandem reaction?
questions.answer: The conversion rate of CO to DEET in the tandem reaction reached as high as 85%.

questions.question: What is the role of NNU-55-Ni-NS in enhancing the photocatalytic CO2 reduction performance?
questions.answer: NNU-55-Ni-NS, formed by in situ exfoliation of NNU-55-Ni, enhances the photocatalytic CO2 reduction performance by providing a larger accessible specific surface area, more active metal sites, and faster electron transfer rate.

questions.question: What are the key components required for the photocatalytic CO2 reduction reaction in the tandem system?
questions.answer: The key components required for the photocatalytic CO2 reduction reaction in the tandem system include the NNU-55-Ni catalyst, [Ru(bpy)3]Cl2 as the photosensitizer, and TEOA as the electron donor.

questions.question: How does the tandem reaction system address the issue of low utilization value of photocatalytic CO2 reduction products?
questions.answer: The tandem reaction system addresses the issue of low utilization value of photocatalytic CO2 reduction products by reconverting the low-value CO product into high-value and easily isolated fine organic chemicals through a series of connected reactions.

questions.question: What is the significance of the tandem reaction system in the context of CO2 utilization and organic synthesis?
questions.answer: The significance of the tandem reaction system lies in its ability to directly convert CO2 into value-added organic chemicals, providing a feasible pathway for the separation and application of CO2 photoreduction products, and expanding the practical application of photocatalytic CO2 reduction technology.
